												I feel like people in this game who reviewed it, did it with obvious hollow bias. Most of the reviews say "It's good, I can play with friends" and such, but none of them go into detail of the games current state.For starters, the community is practically dead. You'll only find about 50+ servers, with a total of about 12 people, the most in one place you'll find is 2 or 3. Even Sven Coop, the game's predecessor, has far more people playing.The developer has Soon™ syndrome. Yes, I know he's working on Black Mesa Source and other games, I'm not bashing him. But I’ve seen it several times on the forums where he promises an update, only for it to never be announced. The last time he said anything publicly outside of the forums was May 28th, 2015. It's been over a year since content has been updated.Combine are insanely overpowered; Weapons have been nerfed. The SMG1 is the most notable. In HL2, you could take the SMG 1 most of the game and it would do. In Synergy, the SMG1 is a pea shooter that can barely kill metro police. The Combine have been mega buffed; they take forever to kill (Even with the new LMG). They'll gun you down in seconds and you'll even be lucky if you manage to harm one considerably.Most of the built in maps are outdated and near impossible to beat since there is no checkpoints. You die, that's it. No setting can change that. Since the maps aren't built around the Combine Weapons changes, you'll be lucky if you even get past any level with combine.The modding community is scarce, barely any mods and they're not very diverse. You can't add player models unless you're a donor, and the only way you can become a donor is if you donate, but you have to wait until the next update for perks. And with a developer suffering Soon™ Syndrome, the approximate time you'd get perks is between now and when Half Life 3 is released. Most of the mods were ripped or stolen directly from Gamebannana, and you could easily make your own just by renaming a few files and swapping things around and then just plopping it in the custom folder like it's nothing.I'm not trying to stomach punch the game or the developer. But people should know the truth instead of hearing the bias in these recent reviews. All I see is "The game is gud I can ply with friendz" or generic copy pasta. I hope this game gets revised and revived somehow, at some point. Because if the games predecessor, Sven-coop is doing better than its successor, then there's quite an issue, isn't there? If you really want a source engine coop game, I'd suggest Obsidian Conflict. Sven-coop if you're on a potato.

												Synergy is one of those little Source mods that can really add a lot of replayability to Half-Life 2. Synergy is simple in what it does - you can play through Half-Life 2 with up to 4(?) friends, but tweaking the maxplayers cvar lets you go up to 16. But that's not all for Synergy. The community have created all sorts of maps for this little mod, most of them being incredibly difficult co-op minigames or objective maps. There are also physics-based puzzle maps where you have your wits and your gravity gun to complete usually around 20 puzzles per map. All of these custom map types are very fun to play, and take Synergy from a co-op Half-Life 2 experience to virtually it's own game. Unfortunately, Synergy hasn't aged well - the server list is very sparsely populated, and there are only a few servers remaining that have any sort of active player base.With that said, if you can get a group of friends together and grab some of the custom-made coop maps, you can have a blast with Synergy. 												HL2 Co-op in a nutshell, folks. Have HL2, and so does your friend? WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR! STOP READING THIS AND PLAY WITH HIM/HER!Ok... you still reading? You must be like me then. Ok, onto specific details.So blah blah blah HL2 co-op, yeah yeah yeah BUT WAIT! NEW STUFF! What's this? A Pipewrench? This is not in HL2 at all! OF COURSE NOT SILLY! IT'S A MOD WITH NEW THINGS! Oh and what's this? A Desert Eagle? Looks like it's from CS:S! It IS from CS:S! But with new animations... wait, no... not new... *modified animations. Hey it's better than nothing, am I right? Seems powerful... wait... it only uses 20 bullets... -_- Oh well, again, better than nothing right? OH WAIT WHAT IS THIS! IS THAT, IT IS! It's a MP5k! It's also new! Seems so useful too... powerful, but 15 bullets less than the MP9 you have in HL2. Oh look, new maps! I want to try these out! OH NO WAIT IT'S A DARK HEADCRAB GET ME AWAY *Loud Scream*. *Dissconect*...My reaction to one of the maps. (Only I didn't scream, I jumped. I am manly! (Not really))So, you still wanting more? Fine, I'll add the Pros and Cons. (As usual)PROS:1. Co-op, where else are you gonna find a Source Co-op game that has to do with HL2?2. Looks like it runs on a new Source engine... reminds me of the engine BM:S uses.3. So much fun... just play it.4. Tweaked maps that the creator(s) did.5. New weapons. Seriously, you can't go wrong with that.CONS:1. Sometimes buggy, like the first level (the trainstation), where you can't go up the ladder and jump out the window. Much much bugs, but that's what you have to deal with.2. Wish there was a Gordon Freeman model... oh well, I can wait for Sven Co-Op 2 to come out.3. Very Hard, that's why you have friends!4. Can't think of anything else.All in all, I give it a 9/10. Yes there are bugs, plus it's hard. But all in all, it's a great game. It puts that smile on you when you are sad and want to play with friends.Hope this review helped!

												Best. Half-Life 2. Mod. On. Steam. HANDS DOWN.This mod adds cooperative multiplayer support, while trying to retain the Half-Life 2-like experience. It not only adds coop support for the levels of Half-Life 2, but it also adds coop support for Half-Life 2: Episode One, Half-Life 2: Episode Two, Half-Life 2: Lost Coast, MINERVA(: Metastasis), Dangerous World, Calamity, Rock 24, Riot Act: Part I, City 7: Toronto Conflict, and Offshore. Unlike Synergy's competitor, Obsidian Conflict, the fanbase is much larger and always (or at least, almost always) online. There are even servers that offer you the ability to play custom community-made coop maps, along with support for other Half-Life 2 & Episodic Mods, such as Mistake of Pythagoras, Ravenholm, They Hunger Again, Coastline to Atmosphere, The Citizen Returns, Causality Effect, Half-Life: Precursor, and even Half-Life 2: Episode Three - The Closure (<----ew)! There is even an official Steam Workshop page that contains additional community-made coop maps and even reskins of models, textures, and sounds! Plus, it's easy to upload your own content to this workshop (srsly, why doesn't gmod use this method?!)!And another thing! Although it's been quite some time since we saw an update, the devs are currently working on adding support for Black Mesa, Half-Life: Source, and Half-Life 2: Update; so now I'm  really  looking forward to it!

												It's Half Life 2, but you get to watch people who are better at the game than you beat most of the monsters and drive you off of cliffs when you ride with them.Really though, Synergy is a great game. It makes re-playing HL2 worth it, even if you've played it a lot in single-player. Inevitably it almost ends up like a speedrun contest, with all the players vying to be among the first four to the end of the level. Quite an entertaining challenge for someone who's familiar with the game already. I haven't seen many custom maps for the game, but from what I've seen there are some great ones. Plus, c'mon, it's HL2. Even if you're not doing as much as your teammates you can still enjoy being in a Half-Life game.My only serious criticisms (aside from trusting total strangers to help you survive) are thus:--Some levels aren't scaled up in difficulty, so the first few people to the scene get to kill everything and everyone else has to play catch-up.--Healing and kill assists don't count for points on the scoreboard.Though there aren't a lot of servers around for this game, there's usually someone on a server somewhere. Even if there's not, there's enough empty ones around that you can invite a few friends over.Overall, I'd give Synergy an 8.5/10.
